metadata.title: CVE-2023-51767 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: OpenSSH through 9.6, when common types of DRAM are used, might allow rowhammer attacks (for authentication bypass) because the integer value ofauthenticated in mm_answer_authpassword does not resist flips of a singlebit. NOTE: this is applicable to a certain threat model of attacker-victimco-location in which the attacker has user privileges.

criterions.comment: openssh package in fips/bionic is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
openssh-ssh1: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
